Once in a quaint village, there lived a boy named Felix who possessed a unique gift: he could taste words. Every time someone spoke, he would savor the flavors that accompanied their speech. Sweet words were like honey, while harsh words tasted bitter like dark chocolate. One day, a traveler arrived, sharing tales of distant lands. Felix was enchanted by the savory richness of his stories, each word bursting with flavors he had never experienced. Inspired, Felix began to write his own stories, blending flavors into words, turning his village into a place where language was celebrated, and every conversation was a feast.
